54.heading: Scottish Highlanders.
54.title: Kidnapped
54.author: Robert Louis Stevenson ; adapted by Mark Jones ; illustrated by Naresh Kumar.
notes: (Campfire Classics)

Summary (from SkyRiver): Retells Stevenson's story about sixteen-year-old David Balfour who, after being kidnapped by his villainous uncle, escapes and becomes involved in the struggle of the Scottish highlanders against English rule.

55.heading: Scottish Highlands.
55.title: "Dark Valley" 6 p. in Mysterious Stories, no. 5
55.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: A man named Alan hiking in the Scotch highlands is warned by an old shepherd in a kilt not to walk through Dark Valley at night. The hiker goes anyway and is soon frightened by the sound of a bagpipe. After realizing what it is, he finds a house and joins a birthday party for a young woman named Jean. They fall in love, but then he notices that none of the partiers is visible in a mirror. The shepherd shows up in the morning and explains that exactly fifty years earlier a forest fire destroyed the house during a birthday party. Alan grows old sitting in Dark Valley, pining for Jean.

89.heading: Scoundrels.
89.title: The Adventures of Basil & Moebius
89.author: story by Ryan Schifrin.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 27 cm.
"Volume 1."
"Red Circle Productions"

Summary (from OCLC): Alaric Moebius and Basil Fox are two lovable scoundrels looking to make a quick fortune. Basil is a former SAS trooper turned Queen's Guard by day and thief by night. Moebius is an Oxford-educated charmer with a knack for getting into trouble. Together they chase adventure under the patronage of The Collector, a mysterious billionaire with a taste for rare and valuable supernatural objects of the occult.

90.heading: Scoundrels.
90.title: "A Bag of Gold Coins : Ancient Tales of Wisdom and Adventure"
90.author: script, Shanti Devi Motichandra ; illustrations, V
90.appears_in: B. Halbe ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 607 (1977, 2009 printing).
notes: (Fables & Humour)

"The precious bag contains the fruits of a lifetime of hard work. Thieves and scoundrels lay claim to it, but foolishness and downright dishonesty thwart their aspirations. As these tales reveal, fate eventually favours only the honest. The stories in this Amar Chitra Katha have been adapted from the Anwar-i-Suhaili, a Persian version of the Panchatantra, written by Hussain Ali Waiz in the 15th century. The tales were beautifully illustrated by famous artists in the court of Akbar and Jahangir."

102.heading: Scourge.
102.title: Warriors : the Rise of Scourge
102.author: created by Erin Hunter ; written by Dan Jolley ; art by Bettina M
notes: "When kittypet Tiny crosses paths with some wild forest cats defending their territory, he is left with scars and a bitter, deep-seated grudge. As his reputation grows among the strays and loners that live in the dirty brick alleyways of Twolegplace, he changes his name to Scourge and puts everything about his old life behind him, except his deadly desire for revenge."
"The #1 national bestselling series, now in manga!"

Summary (from OCLC): Long before the Bone cousins were ever lost in the uncharted forest of the Valley, Big Johnson Bone, the discoverer of the Rolling Bone River, founded Boneville. But little is known of the mighty explorer's adventures before he started his famous trading post. So when Smiley sits down with a group of young scouts to retell the legendary stories of Boneville's origins, what they hear are wild antics complete with Rat Creatures, Dragons, and a snarky little monkey.

206.heading: Scouts and Scouting.
206.title: Paul Joins the Scouts
206.author: Michel Rabagliati.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 26 cm.
(Bdang ; 12)
Translation of: Paul au Parc.
Translated by Helga Dascher.

Summary (from publisher via SkyRiver): "Montrealer Michel Rabagliati returns to the childhood story of his famous semi-autobiographical character. It's 1970 and Paul's family watches the news with anxiety as bombs are going off around Montreal. But Paul is more interested in flying his kite, comics, and his first kiss. Soon Paul joins the Scouts and heads off to camp. Away from his parents and extended family he discovers self worth in a troop of like-minded and enthusiastic boys. Things take a turn, however, when the troop gets mixed up in the terrifying events of the FLQ crisis. Paul Joins the Scouts is a coming of age story which takes an historical approach to both the Baden Powell scouting movement and the October Crisis, but humanizes these incidents for both a YA and adult audience. It is original, sincere, captivating, and a little bit retro."

213.heading: Scowling.
213.title: "Ever Worry about The Perils of Traveling to Distant and Hostile Shores?"

214.heading: Scowling.
214.title: "High Praise, Indeed"
214.author: by Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar scowls and says his dinner is good enough for a dog, and Snert smiles to hear it.

215.heading: Scowling.
215.title: "I Keep Telling Dorothy She's Got to Learn to Control that Nervous Energy"
215.author: Gill Fox.
notes: Summary: He's in a hammock while Dorothy scowls and attacks the lawn with a sickle.

216.heading: Scowling.
216.title: "Prometheus"
216.author: by Jon Macy
notes: Summary: Maria is writing stories of Clovis's love life as though it were her own; Clovis is told to stop scowling if he wants a husband.

219.heading: Scows.
219.title: "I've Handled Faster Scows than This Sad Excuse for a Speedboat!"
